intro: Matelea rubra, commonly known as the red-flowered matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine layer of soft hairs. Matelea rubra is typically found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
